DOCNAME: CASE OF HASAN İLHAN v. TURKEY
CONCLUSION: Preliminary objection dismissed (non-exhaustion of domestic remedies);Violation of Art. 3;Violation of Art. 8;Violation of P1-1;Not necessary to examine Art. 6-1;Violation of Art. 13;No violation of Art. 14;Not necessary to examine Art. 18;Pecuniary damage - financial award;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award;Costs and expenses partial award
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant , a NORP citizen of NORP origin , was born in DATE . He and his family were living in Kaynak hamlet at the time of the events giving rise to the present application .
CARDINAL . The facts of the case , particularly concerning events which took place on or about CARDINAL DATE and on or DATE , are disputed by the parties .

CARDINAL . The facts as presented by the applicant are set out in Section B below ( paragraphs CARDINAL ) . The Government 's submissions concerning the facts are summarised in Section C below ( paragraphs CARDINAL ) . GPE evidence submitted by the applicant and the Government are summarised in Sections D and E respectively .

CARDINAL . The Commission , in order to establish the facts disputed by the parties , conducted an investigation with the assistance of the parties , pursuant to former LAW ( a ) of the LAW . It appointed CARDINAL delegates ( PERSON , PERSON and PERSON ) , who took evidence in GPE from DATE to DATE . They heard the applicant 's son as well as the following CARDINAL witnesses : PERSON , PERSON , PERSON , PERSON , PERSON , PERSON , PERSON , PERSON , ORG and finally PERSON . A summary of the oral evidence given by these witnesses may be found in Section F below .

A further witness , Mr PERSON , the chief public prosecutor in GPE who had questioned the applicant , was also summoned but did not appear before the ORG 's delegates . A letter written by PERSON GPE , explaining his failure to give evidence before the delegates , was read out during the fact - finding hearing . Mr GPE stated that his involvement in the case was limited to his having taken a statement from the applicant and therefore he did not have any further information to offer .

CARDINAL . Kaynak was a small hamlet where CARDINAL families lived . The village of GPE , where CARDINAL families lived , was QUANTITY away from the hamlet of GPE . As both places were very small they were joined so as to form CARDINAL single village . GPE was the centre and PERSON the hamlet . It was built on a hillside and from there the nearby villages of GPE and PERSON , both of which were located at a lower altitude and within CARDINAL kilometre radius , could be seen . To the west of the hamlet was the village of Konaklı where there was a gendarme station . It was QUANTITY away and located at a higher altitude than the hamlet . The villages of Oğuzköy , located QUANTITY to the south of the hamlet , and the village of ORG , QUANTITY away from the village of Konaklı , also had gendarme stations .

CARDINAL . The applicant owned LOC , almond , cherry , fig and oak trees which were located to the west of Kaynak hamlet . He also owned plum , peach and apricot trees which were located in the valley between his hamlet and the village of GPE , located to the south - east of the hamlet . These trees were irrigated by a river which had its source in the village of LOC and flowed to GPE . The applicant owned land in the valley where he used to grow cotton and tobacco . He also kept sheep and goats .

CARDINAL . On or about DATE military units attached to ORG at GPE searched the applicant 's hamlet . No military operation was taking place in the area at the time . The soldiers rounded up the villagers , threatened them and told them that they would be killed if they did not leave the hamlet . The soldiers then burned and destroyed some of the houses and barns using hand grenades , inflammable material and pickaxes . They also killed a number of animals .

CARDINAL . The villagers whose houses had been destroyed left the hamlet and went to the nearby village of GPE to take shelter . On the way to PERSON an elderly woman and DATE old twin brothers lost their lives .
CARDINAL . The soldiers returned DATE , burned the remaining houses in the hamlet and forced the remaining villagers to leave .
CARDINAL . NORP Some time later , the villagers returned to their hamlet to tend their LOC and orchards . They made tents in which to live and erected them in their LOC and orchards .

CARDINAL . On or DATE members of the security forces returned to the hamlet and destroyed what was left of the houses . When the soldiers saw that the villagers would not be separated from their village , the soldiers set fire to the earth in which the LOC and orchards were planted . The ground , crops and trees were burned using petrol , paraffin and other similar inflammable material and sometimes a powder . In the vineyard and orchard owned by the applicant , CARDINAL vines , CARDINAL peach trees , QUANTITY fig trees , CARDINAL almond trees , QUANTITY apricot trees , FAC prune trees and CARDINAL oak trees were burned down . The applicant owned QUANTITY of land .

CARDINAL . After having left his hamlet and taken shelter in an empty house in the village of GPE , the applicant sent petitions to a number of authorities , including the office of the Prime Minister , ORG and ORG and asked for his damages to be compensated . On DATE he received a reply from the Prime Minister 's office , stating that the application for compensation had been passed to the relevant authority and that he would be informed of the outcome by that authority in due course . No compensation was ever paid to the applicant or his family .

CARDINAL . In DATE the applicant was on his way from GPE to the hamlet . He was stopped and searched at ORG . When the replies he had received from the ORG and party leaders were found on him , the applicant was thrown into the station , beaten up and abused . The soldiers burned the documents .

CARDINAL . On DATE military units attached to ORG carried out an operation in the village of GPE with the aim of taking precautionary measures to protect the lives and property of the inhabitants of the village from the ORG . The allegations made by the applicant concerning the destruction of his house , its contents and orchards and finally the allegation that the applicant had been ill - treated at ORG gendarme station were completely baseless .

CARDINAL . CARDINAL member of the LOC family living in Kaynak hamlet had a hideout in the village in which weapons were found . These weapons had been used in a number of killings . The discovery of the hideout revealed the cooperation between that family and the terrorist organisation . This revelation made it difficult for the family to stay in the hamlet , probably because of fear of reprisals from the ORG for having surrendered the weapons . It was much safer to live in a bigger village like GPE .

CARDINAL . According to the registry office responsible for the keeping of title deeds , the applicant owned a total of QUANTITY ( sq . m ) of land which , given its size , could not have accommodated the number of trees which he claimed had been burned down .

CARDINAL . This letter states that no information or documents existed concerning the operations that were conducted on or about DATE in Kaynak hamlet . It further states that no operation took place on CARDINAL DATE in Kaynak hamlet or in its vicinity .

CARDINAL . The evidence of the CARDINAL witnesses heard by the ORG 's delegates may be summarised as follows :

CARDINAL . The applicant 's son was living in Kaynak hamlet at the time of the alleged events . Following the events in GPE in DATE ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) , soldiers used to come to his hamlet and ask the villagers either to become village guards or to leave the hamlet .
CARDINAL . Prior to DATE he heard that there had been an incident at Konaklı gendarme station .

CARDINAL . On DATE , when the witness and other young men saw that soldiers were approaching the hamlet they left the village and hid in the hills on the other side of the hamlet . The reason for their running away from the hamlet was that in the past soldiers who had visited the hamlet had beaten up young men on a number of occasions .

CARDINAL . From their hiding place he could see the hamlet and the soldiers . The soldiers told the villagers to gather outside the village and then started to search the houses . During the search the soldiers destroyed the contents of the houses such as refrigerators , cupboards and food supplies . The soldiers then burned and destroyed some parts of the houses using hand grenades , axes and shovels . The witness was later told that before leaving the village TIME , the soldiers had warned the villagers that they had DATE to evacuate the village .

CARDINAL . On DATE following the soldiers ' first visit , the witness again ran to a hiding place in the mountains when he saw soldiers approaching the village . The villagers were given an opportunity to grab whatever they could from their houses following which the houses were set on fire and many animals were killed by the soldiers . After the soldiers left , the villagers left the hamlet and went to the neighbouring villages . The witness and his family moved to a derelict house in GPE .

CARDINAL . The soldiers returned to the hamlet many times , including once on DATE when they set fire to the orchards , burned the remaining parts of the houses and , on their way to and from the hamlet , set fire to the dense oak forest .
CARDINAL . The witness would like to return to his village if the ORG stopped putting pressure on them .

CARDINAL . Mr DATE son - in - law and nephew of the applicant – was living in Kaynak hamlet at the time of the alleged events . Soldiers used to come to the hamlet in the past and on one of those occasions they had told the villagers that there had been an attack on the gendarme station and asked the villagers to leave the hamlet .

CARDINAL . On DATE soldiers came to the hamlet , gathered the villagers together and asked them why they had not yet left the hamlet . The soldiers then destroyed some parts of the houses in the hamlet , using hand grenades and pickaxes . Before leaving the hamlet , they told the villagers to leave within DATE . On DATE the soldiers returned to the village and burned a few more houses , including the barn and the roof of the witness ' own house .

CARDINAL . The witness and his family left the hamlet and went to PERSON . His DATE old twin sons lost their lives on the way . DATE , he returned to the hamlet to visit it and saw that the applicant 's house had also been burned down . After these events soldiers continued to go to the hamlet and on each of their visits they burned the remaining parts of the houses . The witness heard that DATE after the events , the soldiers had burned down the orchards and other trees around the village .

CARDINAL . Mr Çirik was living in GPE at the time of the alleged events . He heard the sound of gunshots and bombs coming from the direction of Kaynak hamlet . CARDINAL or DATE villagers from Kaynak hamlet came to PERSON and told them that they were being chased by the military . These villagers were then housed in GPE . At DATE , the orchards and other trees were set on fire .

CARDINAL . Captain PERSON was an army captain and commanding officer of ORG at the time of the alleged events . His headquarters had overall responsibility for a number of villages , including that of the applicant 's hamlet , within the administrative jurisdiction of GPE .
CARDINAL . He never asked any villager to become a village guard .

CARDINAL . One evening in DATE , ORG members raided ORG gendarme station . DATE terrorists were arrested . CARDINAL of them were from Kaynak hamlet and their surname was LOC . These CARDINAL persons stated that they had a hiding place in Kaynak hamlet which they showed to Captain PERSON on or around DATE . A number of weapons were found in this hiding place and it was destroyed by the soldiers to prevent the terrorists from using it again in the future . No houses were burned down or demolished by the soldiers during this search . The reports and other documents pertaining to the arrests and the finding of the hiding place and weapons were prepared and submitted to the local public prosecutor .

CARDINAL . He could not remember whether he had ever been questioned by the authorities in relation to the allegations made by the applicant . The reason for his inability to remember was that , in his opinion , these allegations were fabricated and therefore not serious , which was why he had not paid any attention to them .

CARDINAL . The inhabitants of Kaynak hamlet were in the habit of leaving the hamlet DATE to go to GPE where there was more water for their animals . They would then return to the hamlet at DATE . It was possible that the villagers had left the hamlet in DATE following the discovery of the hiding place and the weapons , because they might have feared that the ORG would punish them .
CARDINAL . Sergeant Yılmaz is a gendarme ORG and was commanding officer of FAC at the time of the alleged events .

CARDINAL . A terrorist with the surname LOC , who had been apprehended previously , told them that there was a hiding place in GPE . The witness and a number of other gendarme officers and soldiers visited the hamlet together with the arrested person on or around DATE and recovered a number of weapons from a hiding place . A report was prepared detailing the events of DATE and a sketch indicating the location of the hiding place was drawn up . CARDINAL . Mr GPE is a gendarme expert sergeant who worked at FAC until DATE . His immediate superior was PERSON . There had been an attack on PERSON gendarme station on DATE and a terrorist , who had been arrested DATE after this incident , was detained at ORG . On DATE an operation was carried out in Kaynak hamlet during which the arrested terrorist showed the soldiers a hiding place in which a number of weapons were found . The hiding place was subsequently destroyed by the soldiers using pickaxes . This operation was carried out with the participation of CARDINAL gendarme officers and soldiers from the gendarme headquarters in GPE , and the PERSON and ORG stations . ORG and PERSON , a gendarme ORG , also took part in the operation . Overall command of the operation rested with Captain PERSON . A report was prepared on the spot and signed by the commanders involved in the operation . During this operation no houses were burned down .
CARDINAL . The witness had never been questioned by the domestic authorities about the allegations made by the applicant .

CARDINAL . Sergeant Çalışkan is a gendarme ORG who succeeded PERSON as commanding officer of ORG in DATE . He was entrusted by the emergency governor with the duty to investigate the allegations made by the applicant . He visited Kaynak hamlet to question the applicant but there was no one living in the village . All the houses and LOC were intact . During his time in office until DATE no one lived in the hamlet . He questioned a number of villagers in GPE about the allegations but did not remember their names . He also did not remember checking the official records at the station or questioning his predecessor to verify whether an operation had indeed been conducted in GPE on DATE as alleged . Furthermore , he did not deem it necessary to append any such records to his report since he was of the view that the gendarme headquarters in GPE would already have such reports in their files .

CARDINAL . The witness heard from his colleagues and also from the villagers in GPE that GPE hamlet had been visited by soldiers and a hiding place for terrorists had been found . He was not sure whether this was a relevant piece of information which he should have conveyed to the emergency governor in his investigation report .

DATE . Sergeant Göl is a gendarme ORG who prepared the report of CARDINAL DATE ( see paragraph DATE above ) during his time at ORG . This report was prepared at the request of the emergency governor who had instructed him to investigate the allegations made by the applicant . In the course of his investigation he visited the hamlet , examined a number of documents and questioned several villagers . When he visited the village there were no signs of any burning or demolition of houses ; the houses were still standing , but the roofs of some of the houses had been destroyed due to natural causes .

CARDINAL . The witness stated that there were no reports at the gendarme headquarters in GPE concerning the operation that had taken place on QUANTITY DATE ; had such an operation taken place there would have been reports .

CARDINAL . The witness was living in the village of GPE at the time of the alleged events but did not hear the allegations about the destruction of the houses in PERSON . He had not been to PERSON since DATE . The applicant 's family came to live in GPE at some stage in DATE . The LOC and trees owned by the applicant 's family were still there and had not been burned . The witness and other villagers left their village in DATE due to the intensity of the clashes between the ORG and NORP armed forces , and went to Oğuzköy where there is a gendarme station . He should like to return to his village if the Government allowed him .
CARDINAL . The witness was living in GPE at the time of the alleged events . He subsequently became the headman of the village in DATE .

CARDINAL . The applicant 's family came to GPE at some stage in DATE . It was a lie that soldiers burned some of the houses . He visited Kaynak hamlet DATE where he , “ looked at the house . That house did not have an owner ; it was not maintained . It was dilapidated ” .
CARDINAL . The witness and his family left ORG in DATE together with other villagers . He should like to return to his village but this required the permission of the authorities .
